meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel extreme fear or shock.
meanings.sent1: The scary movie will horrify young children.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected sound in the dark alley can horrify anyone.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was meant to horrify visitors, but it just made them laugh.
meanings.sent4: The idea of losing her favorite toy would horrify the little girl.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure emerging from the fog would truly horrify anyone.

meanings.definition: To greatly shock or disgust someone.
meanings.sent1: The rotten smell from the garbage bin can horrify people passing by.
meanings.sent2: The graphic images in the documentary might horrify sensitive viewers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs might horrify some, but others find it delicious.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal by her best friend would horrify her more than anything.
meanings.sent5: The sight of blood can easily horrify some individuals.
